alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Logan; McLean; Tazewell (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 7:25AM CDT until August 02 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern De Witt County in central Illinois... Northeastern Logan County in central Illinois... Southwestern McLean County in central Illinois... Southeastern Tazewell County in central Illinois... * Until 1130 AM CDT. * At 724 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pekin, Morton, Tremont, Mackinaw, Atlanta, Delavan, Minier, South Pekin, Hopedale, McLean, Green Valley, Stanford, Emden, Armington, Hartsburg, North Pekin, Dillon and Lawndale. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
